data.text: @_mbdr_ @DGBassani An undetermined status (light orange) is because some death certificates remains to be validated, therefore it is not possible to determine cause of death precisely in these cases.
@discoball2000 @_mbdr_ Again…you are spreading dangerous misinformation troll! https://t.co/CfOsnPvVYs

@EpistemologieVS @_mbdr_ @gxsingularity @DGBassani Using EuroMomo data, if you compare Denmark to nearly any other European country they are doing incredibly well. Highlights hi Vax/booster rate + good health system much more important than NPIs.

@toknell @_mbdr_ But that’s how ‘covid deaths’ are counted - any death of someone who tested positive within 30 days of dying. As seen in the UK - when the cause of death is confirmed a lot later than the deaths ‘from’ Covid reduce quite dramatically
@discoball2000 @_mbdr_ the 30 day period does not apply to omicron as it’s been shown several times now by experts. If you’re gaslighting with that then you’re part of the propaganda problem…

@_mbdr_ @toknell No. By definition if 10% of a population is infected with Covid at any one time than 10% of the deaths will occur within 30 days of a positive test result - doesn’t mean they died ‘from’ Covid.

@_mbdr_ @gxsingularity @DGBassani "... except Danes - even if you are a world-class epidemiologist - can interpret it" (without providing any - or manipulative, or flawed - rationale for this claim). 2/2

@_mbdr_ @gxsingularity @DGBassani Any conversation with advocates of Danish opening nowadays tends to end either with "well it's a Danish internal affair and we Danes are OK with it" (as if the whole world is not looking at and/or following Denmark right now) or with "Danish data is so special no-one..." 1/2
